Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) requires good sealant because it works in harsh conditions (high temperature, thermal cycle, oxidative and reducing gas environments).
Titulo: Creep analysis of solid oxide fuel cell with bonded compliant seal design

Sentencas: Bonded compliant seal (BCS) is a new sealing method for planar SOFC.
Titulo: Creep analysis of solid oxide fuel cell with bonded compliant seal design

Sentencas: It uses a thin foil metal to bond the window frame and cell, achieving the seal between window frame and cell.
Titulo: Creep analysis of solid oxide fuel cell with bonded compliant seal design

Sentencas: At high temperature, a comprehensive evaluation of its creep strength is essential for the adoption of BCS design.
Titulo: Creep analysis of solid oxide fuel cell with bonded compliant seal design

Sentencas: In order to characterize the creep behavior, the creep induced by thermal stresses in SOFC with BCS design is simulated by finite element method.
Titulo: Creep analysis of solid oxide fuel cell with bonded compliant seal design

Sentencas: The results show that the foil is compressed and large thermal stresses are generated.
Titulo: Creep analysis of solid oxide fuel cell with bonded compliant seal design

Sentencas: The initial peak thermal stress is located in the thin foil because the foil acts as a spring stores the thermal stresses by elastic and plastic deformation in itself.
Titulo: Creep analysis of solid oxide fuel cell with bonded compliant seal design

Sentencas: Serving at high temperature, initial thermal displacement is partially recovered because of the creep relaxation, which becomes a new discovered advantage for BCS design.
Titulo: Creep analysis of solid oxide fuel cell with bonded compliant seal design

Sentencas: It predicts that the failures are likely to happen in the middle of the cell edge and BNi-2 filler metal, because the maximum residual displacement and creep strain are located.
Titulo: Creep analysis of solid oxide fuel cell with bonded compliant seal design
